Here's a list of made-up creature races that could exist in the world of your game:

1. Glimmers: Small, glittering creatures with wings, known for their speed and agility.
2. Fluffies: Soft and cuddly creatures, with big, round eyes and fluffy tails.
3. Snatchers: Mischievous creatures with long arms, known for their ability to snatch fruits from high places.
4. Munchies: Round, furry creatures with big teeth and an insatiable appetite for fruits.
5. Chirpers: Tiny birds with melodious voices, that bring good luck and happiness to those who hear them.
6. Whippers: Long, slender creatures with tails that can whip and knock fruits out of trees.
7. Sprites: Ethereal creatures made of light, that flit and dance among the fruit trees.
8. Jumper: Small creatures that can jump high and cling to trees and fruits.
9. Fliers: Winged creatures that soar over the fruit trees, watching over them and helping to keep them healthy.
10. Shapeshifters: Mysterious creatures that can change their shape to blend in with their surroundings.

You can use these made-up creature races to create a rich and imaginative world for your game, filled with creatures that each have their own unique abilities and personalities. You can also expand on these races, by adding more details, descriptions, and illustrations to make them even more compelling and memorable.

Here's a list of passive and active abilities for each of the made-up creature races:

1. Glimmers:
Passive Ability: Can fly over obstacles and reach high fruit trees.
Active Ability: Can swap places with any fruit card in play.
2. Fluffies:
Passive Ability: Immune to bug cards.
Active Ability: Can shuffle the deck, making it harder for opponents to predict what's coming.
3. Snatchers:
Passive Ability: Can steal fruit cards from opponents at the end of each round.
Active Ability: Can steal an opponent's fruit card of choice during their turn.
4. Munchies:
Passive Ability: Gain an extra point for every fruit card they collect.
Active Ability: Can eat a bug card in play, gaining an extra point.
5. Chirpers:
Passive Ability: Can distract bugs, preventing them from affecting fruit cards.
Active Ability: Can swap places with any fruit card in play, avoiding bugs and other hazards.
6. Whippers:
Passive Ability: Can knock fruit cards out of trees, allowing them to collect them more easily.
Active Ability: Can knock an opponent's fruit card out of their collection, making it available to all players.
7. Sprites:
Passive Ability: Can become invisible, avoiding bug cards and other hazards.
Active Ability: Can teleport to any fruit card in play, collecting it instantly.
8. Jumper:
Passive Ability: Can jump to reach high fruit trees.
Active Ability: Can jump over other players' cards, avoiding bugs and other hazards.
9. Fliers:
Passive Ability: Can fly over obstacles, avoiding bug cards and other hazards.
Active Ability: Can fly to any fruit card in play, collecting it instantly.
10. Shapeshifters:
Passive Ability: Can take on the form of any other creature card in play, gaining its abilities.
Active Ability: Can take on the form of any fruit card in play, collecting it instantly.

These are just a few examples of the passive and active abilities that each of the made-up creature races could have. You can use these abilities to create a more dynamic and interactive game, filled with creatures that each have their own unique abilities and personalities. You can also modify these abilities, or create new ones, to fit the needs of your game and make it even more fun and engaging.
